text: next on the program I would like to
introduce you to James three years ago
he was sectioned in a psychiatric
hospital having tried to take his life
countless times following the suicide of
his own father
he says football saved his life and last
night he was invited to Parliament to
speak publicly for the first time about
his experiences his talk was moving and
inspirational and he's agreed to share
it with you this morning hi James
how are you in your own time James why
didn't you read what you said to
Parliament last night my story started
three weeks after my 18th birthday when
I was admitted to Park world center for
mental health I become so that for me
life wasn't worth living at 18 I was
ready to die and had many made many
attempts on my own life if I had carried
on the path on that path I wouldn't be
here today something had to change I had
to stop destroying myself and actually
build myself up again and that's when
football won ki prana Community Trust
came in my and saved my life one morning
on the ward Tom the Occupational
Therapist woke me up and asked if I
wanted to play football and of course I
said yes
I didn't really expect much at first but
I realized I had no boots so I rang my
mom and asked if she could get me some
wooden hours she had gone out and bought
me a pair at the time I didn't realize
that if my mom didn't buy me those boots
things might have never changed no might
have lost my life to my mental illness
take time so every week I attended the
training and it gave me hope for the
future that I could be someone my family
and friends could be proud of to me it
wasn't just football it was my life it's
given me stuff to build on instead of
destroying I had become stronger than my
war my demons every week I would put so
much effort in that I couldn't walk for
a few days afterwards it changed me into
a better man and it made me want to stay
alive so my brother my mom and brothers
wouldn't have to bury me instead they
could say to everyone my son and brother
plays for QPR I have done some amazing
things with keep y'all healthy kids my
biggest achievement would be in my first
three seasons that the club I was top
goalscorer every time I put on a kit I
wasn't this ill boy anymore I was James
I was free from my demons unfortunately
others aren't so lucky I made 20th 2010
I lost my father to suicide on my 15th
birthday well I've taken the good from
the bad and I've met amazing people I've
traveled to places to play football I
get to make people proud for a young boy
like me losing my dad left me confusing
this big world I didn't have any sense
of direction
I met my coach's corner and Nathan and
they helped me find my way they stood in
my corner this sport I had for them was
amazing I'm just so thankful they became
my role models they show me that I am
worth I think I'm lucky enough to know
them we can never stop people getting
immensely unwell but we can help them
recover with the use of football it
worked for me and many others that I've
played for against and played with
football save my life
well done
